Pre-Game Insights: Bermuda will look to continue their good form after winning the Subregional Qualifier, using their home advantage to return to the biggest stage in men’s T20 cricket, after their historical appearance in 2007.
Canada, arguably the favourites of the event, will look to confirm this and seal their ticket to a new World Cup participation.
The Cayman Islands are a regular fixture in the regional final but are yet to go through, they will push hard to make it this time.
Panama will be the underdogs, as their participation may come as a surprise to many, but with no real pressure on their backs, this could allow them to play freely and upset the main candidates.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 Americas Qualifier promises to be a competitive affair, with the four teams confident of their chances of making it through to the main stage.
Fara Gorsi, ICC Regional Development Manager – Americas said: “It is exciting to have the regional final that will determine the region’s last spot in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024.”
Calvin Blankendal, CEO of the Bermuda Cricket Board said: “Bermuda is delighted to have the opportunity to host the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup Americas Qualifier in the island.”
Others: The qualified teams so far are Afghanistan, Australia, Bangladesh, England, India, Netherlands, New Zealand, Pakistan, South Africa, Sri Lanka, USA and West Indies.
The top two teams in each of the groups will move to a Super Eight phase, where the remaining teams will be split into two groups of four.
